intro: Aster curvescens var. umbelliformis, commonly known as the Umbellate Aster, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while the flowers form a rounded cluster at the top of the plant. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators.
